post.description:
Gets chat completions for the provided chat messages.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data. The method makes a REST API call to the `/chat/completions` route 
on the given endpoint.

parameters.name: extra-parameters
parameters.description:
Controls what happens if extra parameters, undefined by the REST API,
are passed in the JSON request payload.
This sets the HTTP request header `extra-parameters`.

values.name: error
values.description: The service will error if it detected extra parameters in the request payload. This is the service default.

values.name: drop
values.description: The service will ignore (drop) extra parameters in the request payload. It will only pass the known parameters to the back-end AI model.

values.name: pass_through
values.description: The service will pass extra parameters to the back-end AI model.

messages.description:
The collection of context messages associated with this chat completions request.
Typical usage begins with a chat message for the System role that provides instructions for
the behavior of the assistant, followed by alternating messages between the User and
Assistant roles.

frequency_penalty.description:
A value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their cumulative
frequency in generated text.
Positive values will make tokens less likely to appear as their frequency increases and
decrease the likelihood of the model repeating the same statements verbatim.
Supported range is [-2, 2].

stream.description: A value indicating whether chat completions should be streamed for this request.

presence_penalty.description:
A value that influences the probability of generated tokens appearing based on their existing
presence in generated text.
Positive values will make tokens less likely to appear when they already exist and increase the
model's likelihood to output new topics.
Supported range is [-2, 2].

temperature.description:
The sampling temperature to use that controls the apparent creativity of generated completions.
Higher values will make output more random while lower values will make results more focused
and deterministic.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and top_p for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.
Supported range is [0, 1].

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature called nucleus sampling. This value causes the
model to consider the results of tokens with the provided probability mass. As an example, a
value of 0.15 will cause only the tokens comprising the top 15% of probability mass to be
considered.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and top_p for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.
Supported range is [0, 1].

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate.

response_format.description:
An object specifying the format that the model must output.

Setting to `{ "type": "json_schema", "json_schema": {...} }` enables Structured Outputs which ensures the model will match your supplied JSON schema.

Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables JSON mode, which ensures the message the model generates is valid JSON.

**Important:** when using JSON mode, you **must** also instruct the model to produce JSON yourself via a system or user message. Without this, the model may generate an unending stream of whitespace until the generation reaches the token limit, resulting in a long-running and seemingly "stuck" request. Also note that the message content may be partially cut off if `finish_reason="length"`, which indicates the generation exceeded `max_tokens` or the conversation exceeded the max context length.

stop.description: A collection of textual sequences that will end completions generation.

tools.description:
A list of tools the model may request to call. Currently, only functions are supported as a tool. The model
may response with a function call request and provide the input arguments in JSON format for that function.

tool_choice.description: If specified, the model will configure which of the provided tools it can use for the chat completions response.

seed.description:
If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically such that repeated requests with the
same seed and parameters should return the same result. Determinism is not guaranteed.

model.description: ID of the specific AI model to use, if more than one model is available on the endpoint.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description:
Return the embedding vectors for given text prompts.
The method makes a REST API call to the `/embeddings` route on the given endpoint.

parameters.name: extra-parameters
parameters.description:
Controls what happens if extra parameters, undefined by the REST API,
are passed in the JSON request payload.
This sets the HTTP request header `extra-parameters`.

values.name: error
values.description: The service will error if it detected extra parameters in the request payload. This is the service default.

values.name: drop
values.description: The service will ignore (drop) extra parameters in the request payload. It will only pass the known parameters to the back-end AI model.

values.name: pass_through
values.description: The service will pass extra parameters to the back-end AI model.

input.description:
Input text to embed, encoded as a string or array of tokens.
To embed multiple inputs in a single request, pass an array
of strings or array of token arrays.

dimensions.description:
Optional. The number of dimensions the resulting output embeddings should have.
Passing null causes the model to use its default value.
Returns a 422 error if the model doesn't support the value or parameter.

encoding_format.description: Optional. The desired format for the returned embeddings.

input_type.description:
Optional. The type of the input.
Returns a 422 error if the model doesn't support the value or parameter.

model.description: ID of the specific AI model to use, if more than one model is available on the endpoint.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

post.description:
Return the embedding vectors for given images.
The method makes a REST API call to the `/images/embeddings` route on the given endpoint.

parameters.name: extra-parameters
parameters.description:
Controls what happens if extra parameters, undefined by the REST API,
are passed in the JSON request payload.
This sets the HTTP request header `extra-parameters`.

values.name: error
values.description: The service will error if it detected extra parameters in the request payload. This is the service default.

values.name: drop
values.description: The service will ignore (drop) extra parameters in the request payload. It will only pass the known parameters to the back-end AI model.

values.name: pass_through
values.description: The service will pass extra parameters to the back-end AI model.

input.description:
Input image to embed. To embed multiple inputs in a single request, pass an array.
The input must not exceed the max input tokens for the model.

dimensions.description:
Optional. The number of dimensions the resulting output embeddings should have.
Passing null causes the model to use its default value.
Returns a 422 error if the model doesn't support the value or parameter.

encoding_format.description:
Optional. The number of dimensions the resulting output embeddings should have.
Passing null causes the model to use its default value.
Returns a 422 error if the model doesn't support the value or parameter.

input_type.description:
Optional. The type of the input.
Returns a 422 error if the model doesn't support the value or parameter.

model.description: ID of the specific AI model to use, if more than one model is available on the endpoint.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description:
Returns information about the AI model.
The method makes a REST API call to the `/info` route on the given endpoint.
This method will only work when using Serverless API or Managed Compute endpoint.
It will not work for GitHub Models endpoint or Azure OpenAI endpoint.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

ChatChoice.description:
The representation of a single prompt completion as part of an overall chat completions request.
Generally, `n` choices are generated per provided prompt with a default value of 1.
Token limits and other settings may limit the number of choices generated.

index.description: The ordered index associated with this chat completions choice.

finish_reason.description: The reason that this chat completions choice completed its generated.

message.description: The chat message for a given chat completions prompt.

ChatCompletions.description:
Representation of the response data from a chat completions request.
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

id.description: A unique identifier associated with this chat completions response.

created.description:
The first timestamp associated with generation activity for this completions response,
represented as seconds since the beginning of the Unix epoch of 00:00 on 1 Jan 1970.

model.description: The model used for the chat completion.

usage.description: Usage information for tokens processed and generated as part of this completions operation.

choices.description:
The collection of completions choices associated with this completions response.
Generally, `n` choices are generated per provided prompt with a default value of 1.
Token limits and other settings may limit the number of choices generated.

ChatCompletionsNamedToolChoice.description: A tool selection of a specific, named function tool that will limit chat completions to using the named function.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

function.description: The function that should be called.

ChatCompletionsNamedToolChoiceFunction.description: A tool selection of a specific, named function tool that will limit chat completions to using the named function.

name.description: The name of the function that should be called.

ChatCompletionsResponseFormat.description:
Represents the format that the model must output. Use this to enable JSON mode instead of the default text mode.
Note that to enable JSON mode, some AI models may also require you to instruct the model to produce JSON
via a system or user message.

type.description: The response format type to use for chat completions.

ChatCompletionsResponseFormatJsonObject.description:
A response format for Chat Completions that restricts responses to emitting valid JSON objects.
Note that to enable JSON mode, some AI models may also require you to instruct the model to produce JSON
via a system or user message.

ChatCompletionsResponseFormatJsonSchema.description:
A response format for Chat Completions that restricts responses to emitting valid JSON objects, with a
JSON schema specified by the caller.

json_schema.description: The definition of the required JSON schema in the response, and associated metadata.

ChatCompletionsResponseFormatJsonSchemaD.description: The definition of the required JSON schema in the response, and associated metadata.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The definition of the JSON schema

description.description: A description of the response format, used by the AI model to determine how to generate responses in this format.

strict.description:
Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output.
If set to true, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the `schema` field. Only a subset of
JSON Schema is supported when `strict` is `true`.

ChatCompletionsResponseFormatText.description: A response format for Chat Completions that emits text responses. This is the default response format.

ChatCompletionsToolCall.description: A function tool call requested by the AI model.

id.description: The ID of the tool call.

type.description: The type of tool call. Currently, only `function` is supported.

function.description: The details of the function call requested by the AI model.

ChatCompletionsToolChoicePreset.description: Represents a generic policy for how a chat completions tool may be selected.

values.name: auto
values.description:
Specifies that the model may either use any of the tools provided in this chat completions request or
instead return a standard chat completions response as if no tools were provided.

values.name: none
values.description:
Specifies that the model should not respond with a tool call and should instead provide a standard chat
completions response. Response content may still be influenced by the provided tool definitions.

values.name: required
values.description: Specifies that the model should respond with a call to one or more tools.

ChatCompletionsToolDefinition.description: The definition of a chat completions tool that can call a function.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only `function` is supported.

function.description: The function definition details for the function tool.

ChatMessageContentItem.description: An abstract representation of a structured content item within a chat message.

ChatMessageImageContentItem.description: A structured chat content item containing an image reference.

image_url.description: An internet location, which must be accessible to the model,from which the image may be retrieved.

ChatMessageImageDetailLevel.description: A representation of the possible image detail levels for image-based chat completions message content.

values.name: auto
values.description: Specifies that the model should determine which detail level to apply using heuristics like image size.

values.name: low
values.description:
Specifies that image evaluation should be constrained to the 'low-res' model that may be faster and consume fewer
tokens but may also be less accurate for highly detailed images.

values.name: high
values.description:
Specifies that image evaluation should enable the 'high-res' model that may be more accurate for highly detailed
images but may also be slower and consume more tokens.

ChatMessageImageUrl.description: An internet location from which the model may retrieve an image.

detail.description:
The evaluation quality setting to use, which controls relative prioritization of speed, token consumption, and
accuracy.

ChatMessageTextContentItem.description: A structured chat content item containing plain text.

ChatRequestAssistantMessage.description: A request chat message representing response or action from the assistant.

tool_calls.description:
The tool calls that must be resolved and have their outputs appended to subsequent input messages for the chat
completions request to resolve as configured.

ChatRequestMessage.description: An abstract representation of a chat message as provided in a request.

role.description: The chat role associated with this message.

ChatRequestSystemMessage.description:
A request chat message containing system instructions that influence how the model will generate a chat completions
response.

content.description: The contents of the system message.

ChatRequestToolMessage.description: A request chat message representing requested output from a configured tool.

tool_call_id.description: The ID of the tool call resolved by the provided content.

ChatRequestUserMessage.description: A request chat message representing user input to the assistant.

content.description: The contents of the user message, with available input types varying by selected model.

ChatResponseMessage.description: A representation of a chat message as received in a response.

role.description: The chat role associated with the message.

tool_calls.description:
The tool calls that must be resolved and have their outputs appended to subsequent input messages for the chat
completions request to resolve as configured.

ChatRole.description: A description of the intended purpose of a message within a chat completions interaction.

values.name: system
values.description: The role that instructs or sets the behavior of the assistant.

values.name: user
values.description: The role that provides input for chat completions.

values.name: assistant
values.description: The role that provides responses to system-instructed, user-prompted input.

values.name: tool
values.description: The role that represents extension tool activity within a chat completions operation.

CompletionsFinishReason.description: Representation of the manner in which a completions response concluded.

values.name: stopped
values.description: Completions ended normally and reached its end of token generation.

values.name: tokenLimitReached
values.description: Completions exhausted available token limits before generation could complete.

values.name: contentFiltered
values.description:
Completions generated a response that was identified as potentially sensitive per content
moderation policies.

values.name: toolCalls
values.description: Completion ended with the model calling a provided tool for output.

CompletionsUsage.description:
Representation of the token counts processed for a completions request.
Counts consider all tokens across prompts, choices, choice alternates, best_of generations, and
other consumers.

completion_tokens.description: The number of tokens generated across all completions emissions.

prompt_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the provided prompts for the completions request.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens processed for the completions request and response.

EmbeddingEncodingFormat.description:
The format of the embeddings result.
Returns a 422 error if the model doesn't support the value or parameter.

values.name: base64
values.description: Base64

values.name: binary
values.description: Binary

values.name: float
values.description: Floating point

values.name: int8
values.description: Signed 8-bit integer

values.name: ubinary
values.description: ubinary

values.name: uint8
values.description: Unsigned 8-bit integer

EmbeddingInputType.description: Represents the input types used for embedding search.

values.name: text
values.description: Indicates the input is a general text input.

values.name: query
values.description: Indicates the input represents a search query to find the most relevant documents in your vector database.

values.name: document
values.description: Indicates the input represents a document that is stored in a vector database.

EmbeddingItem.description: Representation of a single embeddings relatedness comparison.

embedding.description:
List of embedding values for the input prompt. These represent a measurement of the
vector-based relatedness of the provided input. Or a base64 encoded string of the embedding vector.

index.description: Index of the prompt to which the EmbeddingItem corresponds.

EmbeddingsResult.description:
Representation of the response data from an embeddings request.
Embeddings measure the relatedness of text strings and are commonly used for search, clustering,
recommendations, and other similar scenarios.

id.description: Unique identifier for the embeddings result.

data.description: Embedding values for the prompts submitted in the request.

usage.description: Usage counts for tokens input using the embeddings API.

model.description: The model ID used to generate this result.

EmbeddingsUsage.description: Measurement of the amount of tokens used in this request and response.

prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the request.

total_tokens.description:
Total number of tokens transacted in this request/response. Should equal the
number of tokens in the request.

ExtraParameters.description: Controls what happens if extra parameters, undefined by the REST API, are passed in the JSON request payload.

values.name: error
values.description: The service will error if it detected extra parameters in the request payload. This is the service default.

values.name: drop
values.description: The service will ignore (drop) extra parameters in the request payload. It will only pass the known parameters to the back-end AI model.

values.name: pass_through
values.description: The service will pass extra parameters to the back-end AI model.

FunctionCall.description: The name and arguments of a function that should be called, as generated by the model.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

arguments.description:
The arguments to call the function with, as generated by the model in JSON format.
Note that the model does not always generate valid JSON, and may hallucinate parameters
not defined by your function schema. Validate the arguments in your code before calling
your function.

FunctionDefinition.description: The definition of a caller-specified function that chat completions may invoke in response to matching user input.

name.description: The name of the function to be called.

description.description:
A description of what the function does. The model will use this description when selecting the function and
interpreting its parameters.

parameters.description: The parameters the function accepts, described as a JSON Schema object.

ImageEmbeddingInput.description: Represents an image with optional text.

image.description: The input image encoded in base64 string as a data URL. Example: `data:image/{format};base64,{data}`.

text.description:
Optional. The text input to feed into the model (like DINO, CLIP).
Returns a 422 error if the model doesn't support the value or parameter.

ModelInfo.description: Represents some basic information about the AI model.

model_name.description: The name of the AI model. For example: `Phi21`

model_type.description: The type of the AI model. A Unique identifier for the profile.

model_provider_name.description: The model provider name. For example: `Microsoft Research`

values.name: embeddings
values.description: A model capable of generating embeddings from a text

values.name: image_generation
values.description: A model capable of generating images from an image and text description

values.name: text_generation
values.description: A text generation model

values.name: image_embeddings
values.description: A model capable of generating embeddings from an image

values.name: audio_generation
values.description: A text-to-audio generative model

values.name: chat_completion
values.description: A model capable of taking chat-formatted messages and generate responses

StreamingChatChoiceUpdate.description:
Represents an update to a single prompt completion when the service is streaming updates 
using Server Sent Events (SSE).
Generally, `n` choices are generated per provided prompt with a default value of 1.
Token limits and other settings may limit the number of choices generated.

index.description: The ordered index associated with this chat completions choice.

finish_reason.description: The reason that this chat completions choice completed its generated.

delta.description: An update to the chat message for a given chat completions prompt.

StreamingChatCompletionsUpdate.description:
Represents a response update to a chat completions request, when the service is streaming updates 
using Server Sent Events (SSE).
Completions support a wide variety of tasks and generate text that continues from or "completes"
provided prompt data.

id.description: A unique identifier associated with this chat completions response.

created.description:
The first timestamp associated with generation activity for this completions response,
represented as seconds since the beginning of the Unix epoch of 00:00 on 1 Jan 1970.

model.description: The model used for the chat completion.

usage.description: Usage information for tokens processed and generated as part of this completions operation.

choices.description:
An update to the collection of completion choices associated with this completions response.
Generally, `n` choices are generated per provided prompt with a default value of 1.
Token limits and other settings may limit the number of choices generated.

StreamingChatResponseMessageUpdate.description: A representation of a chat message update as received in a streaming response.

role.description: The chat role associated with the message. If present, should always be 'assistant'

tool_calls.description:
The tool calls that must be resolved and have their outputs appended to subsequent input messages for the chat
completions request to resolve as configured.

StreamingChatResponseToolCallUpdate.description: An update to the function tool call information requested by the AI model.

id.description: The ID of the tool call.

function.description: Updates to the function call requested by the AI model.

Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.name: api-version
Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.description: The API version to use for this operation.
